definition: Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
historical or literary anecdote that gives rise to a saying
game where the last word of one idiom 成語|成语[cheng2 yu3] is the first of the next

sentences.english: Numerals are used in flexible and diversified ways in Chinese idioms.
sentences.chinese: 數詞在漢語成語中的使用是靈活多樣的。

sentences.english: You got a l5 out of 15 on your Part 1 idiom quiz!
sentences.chinese: 你在第一部分十五道成語測驗題中答對了五道。

sentences.english: Secondly, there are many idiomatic ways of saying things in Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 其次，有許多用中國語說東西的成語說法。

sentences.english: One of the best ways to learn an idiom is by looking at the context in which it is used.
sentences.chinese: 學習成語的最好方法之一是查看它所在的上下文。

sentences.english: The saying "To serve like a dog or horse" describes one person's great devotion to another.
sentences.chinese: 成語“犬馬之勞”比喻一個人對對方的忠心程度。

sentences.english: This paper discusses rhetorical devices of English idioms.
sentences.chinese: 本文論述修辭格的英語成語。

sentences.english: Perhaps I should give you a few idiomatic examples.
sentences.chinese: 也許我該給大家舉出幾個成語例子。

sentences.english: A classical Arab idiom maintains that a flood begins with a mere droplet.
sentences.chinese: 一句經典的阿拉伯成語是“洪水始於涓滴”。

sentences.english: Marking of Word Class in A New Century Chinese-English Dictionary;
sentences.chinese: 漢語四字成語是漢英詞典中不可或缺的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: From this fable comes the idiom Learn to walk in Handan.
sentences.chinese: “邯鄲學步”這個成語就是從這則傳說而來的。

sentences.english: Theres a surprising similarity in the origins of English and Chinese idioms.
sentences.chinese: 在英漢成語的來源上，兩者有着驚人的相似之處。
這個成語把我搞胡塗了。

sentences.english: This set phrase is also used to refer to melodious music.
sentences.chinese: 這個成語也用來形容旋律優美的音樂。

sentences.english: This idiom means relying on another 's power to bully or frighten others.
sentences.chinese: 這個成語用來比喻依仗別人的勢力去欺壓人或嚇唬人。

sentences.english: Compared with the poetry writing, I prefer the four- Chinese-character idioms.
sentences.chinese: 相比較詩詞曲啊，我倒是最喜歡我們的四字成語。

definition: word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
meaning (implicit in a phrase)/implied meaning/hidden meaning/hint/connotation
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
(literary) what is?/what is the meaning of?
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
